ncluding babies 
who are exclusively or 
part breastfed) drinking 
less than 500ml (1 pint) 
or more of infant formula 
each day should receive 
a	supplement	of	8.5–10	
micrograms of Vitamin D 
per day throughout the 
year. See pha.site/vitaminD
• If you do decide to give 
formula, keep your milk 
supply going by continuing 
breastfeeding, or expressing,  
as much as possible.
• Try not to give your baby a 
dummy until breastfeeding 
is going well, as this can 
confuse the baby too much 
and als
